results.title: Injury in sport
results.creator_credit: Newfilms and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Using live-action, animation and diagrams, this film clearly outlines many forms of sporting injuries to the bones, joints, ligaments, tendons, muscles and head. Briefly covers treatment and preventive measures.

results.title: Beat the heat: energy efficient housing
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Nicholas Cockram, South Australian Film Corporation and Telefeatures
results.brief_description: A film designed to show the general public how, by the use of insulation, correct orientation of a house, placement of windows, etc., the unpleasant effects of intensive summer heat can be alleviated.

results.title: The Role of the Coach
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Bruce Moir, Bosisto Productions and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A training film to be used as a discussion starter in the development of new and practising coaches. Emphasises the aims of coaching, the different styles of coaching and individual reasons for involvement.

results.title: How would you like it if?
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, Slater Sound Studio and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A film about moral issues based on the philosophy ‘Think about the deed before you do it - consider other people’. Dramatised excerpts of unsocial behaviour are presented followed by questions asked about the incident portrayed. The content includes examples of wrecking an older brother’s paintings, swearing, shoplifting, school fights and ethnic discrimination.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, Slater Sound Studio and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Two little ears
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Lesley Hammond, Bosisto Productions and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
This documentary looks at the way mentally handicapped children engage with music as a form of expression. It depicts interview footage with the adult carer juxtaposed with scenes of the children singing and dancing.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Bush corridors
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Justin Milne, Newfilms and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film will be of interest to the general public but it is designed primarily for farmers to convince them of the necessity of leaving areas of scrub uncleared. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Porklips now
results.brief_description: Starring William Gray, Ernie Fosselius, John Brent, Mark Lee, Jim Turner. A comedy which casts a running loop parody over ‘Apocalypse Now’. Features Martin Sheen lookalike William Gray as “Dullard” who is sent to deal with a renegade butcher whose low, low prices threaten the profits of the Meatcutters Protective Association.

results.title: Bert Flugelman: public sculptor (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Lesley Hammond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The work of Bert Flugelman is presented, particularly the design and casting of his famous sculpture pieces in Martin Place, Sydney, in Canberra and in Adelaide. His work in other mediums, e.g. pottery and painting is also presented, demonstrating the process of sculpture construction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scott Hicks, Lesley Hammond and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Nails
results.creator_credit: Phillip Borsos, John Taylor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A non-narrated look at the manufacture of nails, juxtaposing highly mechanised factory production with the slower outputs of a small business and a single blacksmith. The blacksmith is seen labouring at his forge, shaping nails from single strands of steel rods. The scene shifts from this peaceful setting to the roar of a twentieth century mill, where banks of machines draw, cut and pound the steel rods faster than the eye can follow. These diametrically opposed scenes emphasise the changed relationship between the individual and his work. (Awards: New York, Chicago, Toronto)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phillip Borsos, John Taylor and ONF | NFB

results.title: Power and the land
results.creator_credit: Joris Ivens, United States. Dept. of Agriculture and United States. Film Service
results.brief_description: Sensitive portrayal of American ideals and lifestyles, made to explain and promote the Department of Agriculture’s program of rural electrification. Filmed on the farm of Bill and Hazel Parkinson in St. Clairsville, Ohio, capturing the hardship of a nonelectrified farm and the progress and profit brought by electricity. The film is critical of the reluctance by public utility companies to install power to rural areas. A significant documentary that elevates the status of farmers and the value of their work. Cinematography, Floyd Crosby and Arthur Ornitz. Script, Edwin Locke. Editing, Helen van Dongen. Commentary by Stephen Vincent Benet. Music, Douglas Moore.
